intro: [WRONG START] Astellia nervosa var. chathanica, commonly known as the Chatham Islands astelia, is a unique grass-like plant native to the Chatham Islands of New Zealand. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It is known for its resilience to wind and salt spray, making it well adapted to its harsh habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
